website_summaries.verdict: Light and flexible, these colorful rings are easy to spot and grab on the bottom of the pool.
pros: 6 classic, colorful rings weighted to sink and stand on the bottom of the pool
Great for games and swim training
Light and flexible, not hard plastic
Do not melt in the heat
cons: The inner edge of the molded plastic is fine for one child to handle, but can twist and pinch fingers if 2 children are tugging on it

customer_reviews.title: Big hit for my 2 and 5 year old!
customer_reviews.text: My kids recently completed ISR training and the instructor had one of these. This was the only thing that got my kids to happily cooperate throughout their lesson, as well as while the other was going, since he would let them play with it once the lessons were over. This stingray glider is awesome and swims so well. Take it to the bottom of the pool, let go, and awhile it goes. My kids were so sad when their lessons were over that they weren't going to be able to play with it that I decided to get one for our house. This has been a big hit on our pool every time we go swimming!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are not the standard hard plastic rings but instead the soft rubbery kind; they are a pretty light and flexible. The inside of them are actually open/hollow all the way around (see pic), but it allows them to sink pretty well despite their weight and material. They move along the bottom of the pool easily but it's a nice challenge for my teenage kids to search for. The video shows me tossing the rings in the center of my pools (approx 5 feet deep). You can see they sink fairly quickly. Overall, I'm satisfied with the purchase. I was expecting them to be the hard plastic style but these work pretty well too.
customer_reviews.author: A.K

customer_reviews.title: Because you can.
customer_reviews.text: Get the heck out! This thing is enormous and the lights are fun! I am not kidding you--I am not a tiny person, and I can belly flop onto this beauty and float happily around my pool. Very roomy. Sitting up, though, is not as supported as the photo makes it look--the tail kind of leans back. We use this mostly for tanning our backsides! Holds several little kids or one happy 50 year old.
customer_reviews.author: PalliNurse

customer_reviews.title: A+ for princess peacock
customer_reviews.text: This is my first inflatable pool toy and I'm absolutely in love with it. It was super easy to inflate with a pump and it is very sturdy and durable. 2 average size adults can ride on the floaties at once. It's also extra wide which makes it easier to get on and off without it toppling over. I was a little concerned the pool that I was in had rocks around it but the material held up just perfectly. I have yet to use the lights but I'm looking forward to it. Just an FYI the lights require 3 AAA batteries that are not included.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Cool Pool Toy
customer_reviews.text: Very unique toy to add to the pool toy arsenal! It really works quite well. The design of the toy counteracts it's buoyancy causing it to go straight rather than float up. There are adjustments that can be made with the wings to make it respond differently, not very consistent results for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grand daughter. What a hit at the pool! I gave everyone information for purchase at the pool. And I'm purchasing more too!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S

customer_reviews.title: these are proving to be a great purchase. I think this design is superior to ...
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks in, these are proving to be a great purchase. I think this design is superior to many others because it doesn't need to hold water to sink, thus it doesn't get funky inside and later make a mess in the garage. Inexpensive and they've survived at least a dozen pool parties so far. They dont appear to be fading at all despite the summer sun, and I may get another set as my daughter continues to work on her diving and swimming.
customer_reviews.author: GLo

customer_reviews.title: Lots of (grown-up!) fun in these small rays! Kids like 'em, too.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of small. It took us while to figure them out, but now we have a blast. Actually, I think the grown-ups have more fun than the kids do! You can make them do all kinds of different things, but you never know exactly what. My biggest tip is to let them sit in the water about 10-15 minutes before using them. I don't know why, but they work better when soaked.
customer_reviews.author: OC Tita

customer_reviews.title: Kids got bored trying to make these work.
customer_reviews.text: The mini's are really rather small. The main body is only about the size of the top of a soda (or beer) can. Product picture of the glider being about the size of the child is really deceiving. We found them difficult to use. You have to dive deep to get any sort of action. I wouldn't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Just another toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy did not perform as it is described or as well as I had hoped. We could not figure out how to make it do any stunts other than shoot out of the water and even that was minimal. Changing the positions of the fins did nothing to change the performance or range. Maybe someone with more patience or determination could make it perform better but me and kids were disappointed and didn't want to study it further. When it did glide it was a short distance but not even half the width of the pool (glides maybe 6 ft). It is not worth the cost for me and provide limited entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: oborocreativecarver

customer_reviews.title: Epic Dragon Floaty
customer_reviews.text: This epic dragon floaty made me fall in love with pool lounging. Sturdy, huge and wide, this monster floaty withstood us launching ourselves off the side of the pool and into its dragon arms (figuratively speaking). We haven’t tried the lights yet, but what we’ve experienced thus far this product equals 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ayaaaa

customer_reviews.title: Dragon  can’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes for this and it looked really cool for about 4 hours and then started to lose air. Poor dragon. This pic was taken 24 hours after I bought it. I can fill it with air every 24 hours but I think I would rather not
customer_reviews.author: Siperbowl

customer_reviews.title: Super fun in the kiddie pool
customer_reviews.text: Works very well in shallow and/or quiet pools. The younger kids had problems hearing them when the pool was loud and in the deeper part of the shallow end. My 5 year old nephew loved them in the kiddie pool and also close to the steps in the shallow end. When his 10 year old sister took them further away from the steps in the shallow end he had a harder time hearing them and she had to be under the water to hear them when the campground pool was half full. When they were alone in the pool at night they worked great. Excellent in the super shallow or kiddie pool. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed... Not same features as the large stingray
customer_reviews.text: I read the questions & answers column before purchasing this one.The seller mentioned that it's same exact item. same features only the mini is smaller as compared to the large one. After taking this out of package and trying to glide,it seems to bend only in one direction.If you bend one side of the wing then the other side glides up.I purchased thinking it would work the same way as the large one. Disappointed with this one. Q) How does the performance of the stingray compare with the mini stingray? Answer:Same exact item. the mini is just smaller. Same features.
customer_reviews.author: NV

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but.......
customer_reviews.text: This is the only kind that is shiny, as opposed to dull, plasticky color of other diving fish toys. However, the plastic film that connect the metal pieces together is very flimsy. One broke before even touching the water, and the other followed the same fate within 5 min of inside the pool. Very disappointed, not to mention the sad faces when my girls handed me the broken pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jliu

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. I literally was unboxing these when my 2yo took one and dropped it on the floor. Keep in mind, he’s 2 so it fell merely inches. It broke. It’s cheap plastic held together by a cheaper, thinner plastic. The rest will be thrown out as well.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Interesting toy
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job of travelling underwater. The lift from the foam core is directed by the wings and provide a very flat trajectory. The only downside is that it is difficult to keep it from turning. Flexing the wings to correct is hit or miss. The glider, if it is deep enough, will jump out of the pool when it hits the side - good for a scare or two.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C

customer_reviews.title: It zips through the water
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea what it was I was buying when I bought it, but it sounded like fun. And it was! All you need to to is push it down under water, and let it go! You can adjust the wings to have it make turns. We set up an underwater obstacle course. If you take it down to the deep end of the pool, push it to the floor and then let go, it can make it all the way to the shallow end. Loved this!
customer_reviews.author: retiredinmiami

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: These are good rings to dive for if your not wanting to spend much money. But, they take forever to sink so the kids don't wait for them and grab them before they drop. Also they warped after wards. We used them in Vegas for the weekend but when we got home they aren't circles anymore. I don't know if it was the heat or what but they are all wavy now. Hopefully they will flatten back out the next time we go swimming. But...... you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Cute and unique!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these and I can’t find them anywhere else. Bought these last summer but the wings broke, which I have to say that of course they did considering how much my kids have used them. so I bought another set thus summer , which is totally worth it! They really do glide and all the other kids at the pool want to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: Christel

customer_reviews.title: Only One Makes Noise
customer_reviews.text: If I had known that only ONE of the three Dive Stix made noise, I would not have bought them. I was quite disappointed, as I did not see that information anywhere. If it weren't so much trouble, I would return them. I guess I'll just keep them and let the kids use them. The photo shows four and I only got three, so I guess none of the description was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Sucked!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews on water rings and they are all over the place. So I chose these. If you notice in their “care & maintenance” section it says to rinse and dry completely. WELL...they aren’t sealed! Then there’s this bit of foam inside (probably to help them sink). I instantly thought Mold! Instant return. Didn’t even test them out. Who dries their rings after each use?
customer_reviews.author: Beaverhausen

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: We were using these in the pool for less than a 20 minutes & 2 of them broke. Not worth the price. They look cool , but are not sturdy. The “bones” are connected by clear plastic that easily breaks.
customer_reviews.author: KIM

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Our great grand-daughter not yet 5 loves throwing these into the pool and driving under to get them. At first it was only in the shallow area. Then she started advancing further down until she was in the deepest. She would say I can't and I'd tell her yes she could and after a few tries she could swoop down and pick up a couple and dive down to get the rest. Best purchase I've made for her - great pool investment.
customer_reviews.author: cam

customer_reviews.title: The rings do not always stand up under water.
customer_reviews.text: I bought some rings which were joined together and after awhile they came apart. I thought these rings would be stronger since there is no joint they are one piece. However, the rings are a little disappointing because they do not always standup. There is a groove in the inner side of the ring and if they fill with air, then they will stand up, if not they will lie flat as shown in the photo. Note the red ring lying flat. Kids will have a harder time picking up the rings when they lie flat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sasaki

customer_reviews.title: Fun pool toy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for pulling out during a pool party and giving the kiddies a little "wow" factor. They'll get bored after a few minutes each time, but they tend to always want to play with it for at least a few minutes every time I toss it in the pool. The "adjustable" wings aren't very reliably adjustable (it sort of always likes to curve the same direction regardless), but it's still super cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Aqua Sonic Die Sticks
customer_reviews.text: The one that made the sound sounded good and the grand kids enjoyed diving for the dive sticks the first time they used them. The dive stick did not make the sound the second time they used them. I changed the batteries which was a pain to get to, and found them soaked. Even with fresh batteries no more sounds.
customer_reviews.author: drifter 33

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work like description
customer_reviews.text: I got the two minis and right away the next day I gave one to each of my grand children for the pool. We put them all the way to the 5ft bottom and they never once popped out of the water. They just went around and eventually came up to the top of the water. Maybe if I had gotten the big one? Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tootsaroni

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the pool
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to help my 4-year-old daughter practice some of the things she's learning during her swim instruction. Not only has she really improved with holding her breath, because of these, she's also becoming more confident swimming and diving in the deeper side of the pool. A great and inexpensive pool toy to not only help with technique but fun for play time as well.
customer_reviews.author: ShaeCabby

customer_reviews.title: This is a truly fun toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: It has adjustable wings and it is quite durable and when setup correctly it will do slow circles and gradually come to the surface. From the bottom of a 10ft pool we have seen as many as 6 slow circles (about 8ft diameter). Truly fun to watch! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: fun, but break very easily.
customer_reviews.text: These are really fun, but unfortunately do not last at all. We bought two sets and one set broke within a week (the wings just seem to break off.) The seller replaced, which was great, but the new ones also broke quickly. They do stay under the water and swim like real fish for a bit, so they are pretty cool. Since they are pretty cheap, I'm not taking off 4 stars, but it is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Bright colors but sink slow.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these are fun, but they sink to the bottom of the pool soooooo s l o w l y. I guess they're a little too lightweight. Also, make sure the white piece of foam stays in the ring if you want it to stand upright on the bottom. My child's friend took it upon himself to remove them, but luckily my kiddo got upset and found the white pieces and brought them to me.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: These actually work
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were pretty awesome for my boys. A good physics lesson for them, basically the buoyancy of the foam fights with the wings of the stingray which are pointed down, and they kind of cancel each other out and end up going straight. These really do glide underwater, probably the farthest we got was about 15 yards or so (maybe halfway across the swimming pool). You do have to fiddle with it to get it to straight, but that's part of the fun. Other people gathered around and wanted to check it out.
customer_reviews.author: LLK

customer_reviews.title: Rings do not reliably stand up
customer_reviews.text: The product description explicitly says that the rings are weighted such that they sink and stand up. Out of the six rings that came with the package, only one ring sort of stood up, two barely stood up, and three lay flat on the bottom of the pool. I read the product review for several different brands, and I thought I was choosing one that passed muster. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: SongMonk

customer_reviews.title: Unsure how to adjust the wings.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to figure out how to adjust the the wings with out break them. I found the toy didn't sore straight but just did circles from the bottom of the pool to the top of the water. The little kids played with them as just toys so it wasn't a complete waste but the 13 year olds didn't they they were as cool. We had hoped to use them as a race/dive toy and it just simply did not work out.
customer_reviews.author: Chanay Huff

customer_reviews.title: This Dragon is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We received this dragon. We blew it up - no one got on it that day - the next day it was barely inflated. This is a POS - do not buy it! It sure looks cool, but trust me, that lasts for a couple hours. Can't even find a leak. Sending it back and I hope Amazon TAKES THIS CRAP off their website. Wish I'd read the reveiws before I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Cool Pool Toy
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to keep kids entertained.. even in the pool. This pool toy propels in different directions depending on the side that you flip it on., Travels pretty far across the pool and even "climbs" the wall. The kids really enjoy this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Sze

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 10 minutes in the pool
customer_reviews.text: This is our 3rd attempt this summer, but this design appears to have too many weaknesses and breaks quickly. The main the head, side wings (needed to stabilize) and tail are each glued to the main body of the float. The tail seems to tare away first as it sticks up at an angle. Next, the side wings tare away and this beautiful peacock looks (and floats) like it has been in a war. Buy it expecting it not to last - unless you or others in your pool are especially careful.
customer_reviews.author: Technically adept customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the sharp inside edge
customer_reviews.text: My kids had a great time with these rings, until one of them got a cut on her hand from the sharp edge on the inside of the ring. The edge doesn't appear dangerous, but children tend to use toys in ways that parents don't anticipate! My daughter was holding the ring out for her friend to catch it when she got to the bottom of the waterslide, and when the friend got to the bottom of the slide and pulled the ring out of my daughter's hand, it gave her a pretty bad cut. Small but important design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M

customer_reviews.title: Rings lay flat on bottom of pool. These DO NOT stand up properly.
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. These rings do not stand up underwater like previous ones we've had. These rings have a tiny piece of styrofoam inside the ring to create a bouancy; however, that doesn't work. Very cheap! If you don't mind the rings laying flat on the bottom of the pool, then you might not have an issue with these. If you're looking for the ones that have the balance just right and they stand up on the bottom of the pool so your kid can easily grab them, then these are NOT the rings you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must toy for the pool!! Great for adults and kids
customer_reviews.text: We had just finished our pool last year and never got toys. Well these rings were on of the toys we bought this years and I must say these are the ones that the adults and kids used the most!!! Definitely great and don't melt on the extreme heat! Good size too and the colors are nice and vibrant!! There isn't one day in the pool without these rings. And it keeps u and the little one very active lol. A must buy for the pool!!
customer_reviews.author: Fabianna

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Looked and worked great. Bought for a bride for bachelorette party
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea C

customer_reviews.title: Best Pool Toy of 2018
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy another cheap looking pool toy but for a little under $10 I thought, why not. My niece spent over an hour playing with this thing the first day and is the number one pool toy for kids when they show up at our pool on weekends. I also have to admit I found myself holding this thing under water to see how far it would go. So far this is the best pool toy I've purchased in 2018. Hours of fun!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hannifin

customer_reviews.title: Ring of disappointment
customer_reviews.text: No where near as good a quality as I would have liked and I should have returned it, but it was a joke gift for my partner for our anniversary. The quality reminds me of those cheap 'Intex' inflatables they sell at Target and Walmart. As soon as you inflate it it looses pressure and is never as firm or buoyant as you would like.
customer_reviews.author: David J Tyreman

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Cool little toy. Pictures a bit deceiving because it looks like it will pull you underneath the water or something like that. It’s entirely just fun to watch, you let it go underwater and it swims around and then jumps out. It’s really small. Cool but misleading if you looked at just the pictures
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy them again
customer_reviews.text: These are okay pool toys but I don't think they are worth the money. They are supposed to have adjustable fins but one of ours was clearly broken and didn't adjust. Even the one that does adjust doesn't seem to do much. They just sort of slowly float away from you and don't go very far.
customer_reviews.author: Nicksname

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving picture
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for a big package to be delivered because in the photo the toy looks to be over 2 feet across the wing span. I got a plastic envelope from Amazon. I thought it was a magazine or t-shirt but inside the envelope were the 2 gliders. We will see how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Christina L Helms

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: It was fun the first day using it. Unfortunately after a couple of uses the slightest bends causes it not to move well in the water .. just spins etc cheap product, good for a day
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Fun idea!
customer_reviews.text: Fun new pool toy. Love how they try to swim up against something almost as if they are real. Kids can play with these for hours in the pool just passing them back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: B. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Stingray
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves sting rays and other ocean creatures. This sting ray is huge it actually is made to be put in the pool. You could fill up the bath tub and put it in, but there is not enough room for it to float. Good purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is super cool and is really fun for the pool. My son is 8, and he loves using it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Deuces

customer_reviews.title: Lights do not work.
customer_reviews.text: The sturdiness of the float is great. It’s big just like we were looking for. But the light functions do not work. At first only the one out of four light pods were working. The next time we used it, it wasn’t working at all. It was very disappointing since the 12 AAA batteries cost almost half of what the float cost. It’s too inconvenient to even take the batteries back out so we just left it in without it working. Don’t even bother with the light functions and wasting your money and time installing the pods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cheaply made, definitely overpriced for 4 chintzy rings
customer_reviews.text: I’d be surprised if these last more than this summer. Don’t get me wrong, I don’t require that much craftsmanship in my pool toys (in fact, I usually get this kind of stuff from the dollar store) but these seem especially cheap. Not a big deal, but next time I’ll head to my local brick and mortar pool supply store and get something that’ll last...no need to add more junk to the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Allen Family

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: This isn't what I was expecting at all lol..you have to hold it on the bottom of pool(deep side) and it shoots off but only moves for like 20 seconds I thought it would be moving around longer..but great for smaller kids not 11+
customer_reviews.author: Angel Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: A fave!
customer_reviews.text: Wishcash, as my son named ours, was by far our best purchase for our recent trip. I probably played with it more than the kids lol! It’s easy to use and glides quite far!
customer_reviews.author: Kassie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, kid loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Great pool toy. The kid tries to race it across the pool and it can go pretty far. The only down side is it can be difficult to set the wings up so that it swims straight instead of doing a circle.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Marcotte

customer_reviews.title: They Don't Stand Up
customer_reviews.text: They don't stand up. They have a small piece of foam on one side which didn't help them stand at all. The ones with weights on the bottom work much better. These are also very flimsy compared to the other harder plastic versions which caused them to warp in the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Sleeper
customer_reviews.text: Took a change and was a real winner. Became a big hit with children/adults with seeing who could get it to swim/glide underwater the farthest. Deeper you release, the farther it will go. Would definitely buy again, but the stingray is pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Vern Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Best Pool Toy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Aqua Stingray- We spent hours playing and chasing this simple toy around the pool. I love that it takes no batteries and provides hours of entertainment. My kids begged to go swimming today just so they could play with it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Ridley

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 packs by mistake, glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Simple durable I'm glad I bought 2 packs by mistake 12 are much more fun. We drive for these, play ring toss with floating flamingo or ring basket ball with a round floaty.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: Even though I feel like this costed about $20-$30 more than the sum of its parts if you bought them individually it's still pretty neat. We haven't used this in the water, we set it up outside of our camp at a festival and people were loving it. It would have been nice if it came with six lights instead of four, I think that's a reasonable ask since the thing cost $60 but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: My Name Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap fun
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old had a lot of fun with these. We had no trouble making them go a good 15 ft under water. He made lots of friends because of these. Little boys chasing them and taking turns launching. Lasted 4 days and still fine.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 1 week
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved these stingrays for the week they lasted before the wings cracked. Only buy this for a one week vacation, it won't last any longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The first 20 min it worked great, then once my daughter played with fins it never went straight again. Pain coming of after 1 day in pool. I was going to return my daughter said No don't return. She will never use again, my lose.. You read your gain.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Christopher Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fun But Hazard to Little Fingers
customer_reviews.text: These rings held up for a pool party, but the inside of each ring has some sharp plastic that cut a few fingers. I didn't check beforehand. These can easily be filed down before use. They are flexible rings and sink to about mid pool.
customer_reviews.author: MOM_DRG

customer_reviews.title: Great, totally durable.
customer_reviews.text: We used the diving rings all summer with no problems. They held up great. The only problem we had was losing them because other families, at the pool, had the same ones. I think next summer I will put colored tape on ours to help differentiate them.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lots fun, make kids dive million times so they can have good nite sleep lol
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get it when first got it and thought what a crappy product lol after try and error, it simply require you to just leave on the bottom of the pool with no force then it start to glide/float.
customer_reviews.author: Lian DeAbreu

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Opened this and blew it up in the evening. Didnt even use it, let it sit in the garage anf the next morning it was already gping flat. Came to us with a hole in the seam. And of course my return window is over :( looks like it could b fun if we got to use it!
customer_reviews.author: samantha L

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son as a Christmas gift and he loves it. We have taken it to the pool and it is fun to see where it ends up. Several times others in the pool did not see it until it came up in their face. We had one woman scream because she thought it was alive and attacking her. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Definitely good for underwater swimmers
customer_reviews.text: I teach swim lessons to young children and I found that these rings worked alright for the their price, but was a little disappointed that they didn't all stand up in the water. Overall I think they are pretty average rings and would definitely recommend them for kids who are comfortable swimming under water.
customer_reviews.author: JHandy1414

customer_reviews.title: Fun alone or with friends
customer_reviews.text: Love love this guy ! Move his wings a certain way he boomerangs back to ya or move another he swims under water straight to the other person Lots it fun with someone or alone
customer_reviews.author: Carol R Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Durable plastic construction
customer_reviews.text: We received the product with a dime size hole in the plastic. Our grandchildren were so excited to use the dragon , we attempted to repair it using the patch provided. In hindsight, it was a poor temporary fix & we should have returned the product right away. We were satisfied with the durable product construction ....however the lights were quickly unusable as they have all rusted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It glides
customer_reviews.text: It does slowly glide to the surface. I bought this as a water toy for my dogs. DK yet if it will work as a pool toy for them but I’m hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Martie

customer_reviews.title: Glides excellently
customer_reviews.text: Told kids to take it easy with these toys but have fun. Wow, they sure did. Had them for 2 weeks and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen M

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It is very big which is great but it doesnt work as advertised and it does not glide either it think not happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Zulma Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Fun, and I'm an adult
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these. Playing with the fins to change the behavior of the toys is good physics education for the kids too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: what is all the fuss about
customer_reviews.text: this got great reviews. i feel totally hoodwinked. on what planet is this a toy worth playing with? can't figure out who would enjoy this. we sure got bored fast.
customer_reviews.author: marsh

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fun for kids. no batteries necessary. Kept kids entertained for a long time and they are looking forward to using it another day.
customer_reviews.author: alr3pitt

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: Skip this one. The quality is horrible for the price. Misadvertising, it barely moves underwater. Huge disappointment. I would say you get what you paid for but no, this was not even worth $1.
customer_reviews.author: Not Happy!

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great fun!! My whole family plays with it in the pool. Everyone from kids to adults. It's very durable and is great for entertaining. My grandkids named it "Mr Ray"!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Broke Instantly
customer_reviews.text: 1 broke straight out of the package. A 2nd broke within 5 minutes of using in the pool. The 3rd somehow hasn't broken yet, but we have only used it once for about 10 minutes... the plastic connecting all the colored pieces is super thin and the whole thing feels very cheap. I would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Swims on its own!
customer_reviews.text: This fish is so cool because it swims automatically underwater. The kids love it and chase it around in the pool. The fins are a soft foam and it’s easy to pack in the swim bag. No batteries and fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: It seemed cool
customer_reviews.text: It broke after a few uses. Never was able to make it go across the whole pool (15’) . Won’t buy again , it was cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges inside
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved playing with these in the pool. A few things - the color didn't fade quickly and the rings kept their shape. However - if you have two kids that are fighting over one ring, apparently there are sharp edges inside the rings and my son got his hand cut pretty badly. So, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: They are super cheaply made. Within 1 minute of opening the package, 1 was dropped and shattered on the ground. Very fragile. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kessler Az

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is fun. It floats and glides through the water and looks like a real ray. My kids love chasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 30 secs
customer_reviews.text: My 1 yr old broke a fish before I could even get the other two out of the package, Im returning them.
customer_reviews.author: jay H

customer_reviews.title: 3 Year Old Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my 3-year old son is in swimming lessons and he cannot wait to do rings at the end of each class. We have a pool so I figured i'd buy some and work with him on some stuff at home. Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: ESOCCER225

customer_reviews.title: Fun water toy
customer_reviews.text: Fun water toy. Challenging to aim it and get it to go that direction, but we all enjoyed trying! It held children's attention.
customer_reviews.author: Smiles and Blossoms

customer_reviews.title: Everyone wants one
customer_reviews.text: Great toy and daughter said all the kids wanted one after playing in the pool with grandson’s. Works well and lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: T.D. Jones/Author

customer_reviews.title: They are cool dive toys because you have to chase them
customer_reviews.text: They are cool dive toys because you have to chase them, unlike other dive toys that just sit still. The only bad part is that the wings sometimes bend so they just go in circles.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cool
customer_reviews.text: My 8’yr old and my husband love this. It’s great as a birthday present. You can buy 2 and race them...just saying
customer_reviews.author: Angela katsikas

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: I don’t review many products but this one deserves a review it’s super fun. Put it under foot and release at bottom of pool and it will go forever also floats so it easy for my little ones to play with
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend as a bath toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my baby to play with in the bath tub. Unfortunately, they're a bit bigger than expected, and their tricks are better saved for a swimming pool. That being said, they are fascinating little items.
customer_reviews.author: ille tempestas

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to write home about.  Basic and mildly boring.
customer_reviews.text: This toy just wasn't very much fun. It mostly does what it's supposed to but certainly didn't get much action at our house. It looks cool, so any new kids go right for it, but my own kids haven't touched it since day one.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey L. Carty

customer_reviews.title: Great to help my grand daughter
customer_reviews.text: My Grand daugher has been taking swimming lessons at the Y for years. I bought these to help her in going under water. They are used in he class, so when I swim with her we can use them together for practise.
customer_reviews.author: James. Backus

customer_reviews.title: Breaks apart easily
customer_reviews.text: Within one use this item fell apart not worth the money or time.
customer_reviews.author: MommyTigerOf2Cubs

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Way smaller than I expected but that’s my fault for not looking at the details. Kids still enjoy them though and they’ve held up nicely with 3 and 6 year old boys.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: These rings were perfect for the pool. Great size and color, and we loved the sparkles. Sank as designed and have provided hours of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fun to watch!
customer_reviews.text: Fun to watch ! Looks cheap but kids and even grandma enjoys trying to glide it to each other!
customer_reviews.author: btagz

product_meta.title: Aqua Classic Dive Rings, 6 Pack, Pool Toys for Kids, Toddlers, Teens, Pool Game, EZ Grab Large Diameter Swim Diving Rings
product_meta.description: Style:Classic Dive Rings (6-Pack)With over 40 years of fun and innovation, Aqua leisure, a family-owned business, has been a leader in water leisure products. With a mission is to provide fun, safe and innovative recreational products for the entire family to enjoy, they aim to provide products that foster a lifelong love of fun in the water and the outdoors.never leave children unattended while pool games are being used. Supervision by a competent adult swimmer should always be provided to children playing with this game. This product should only be used by children who are already excellent swimmers and are fully comfortable with diving underwater. Products should always be removed from water when not in use. Good sense and Caution should always be exercised. Some pools are too shallow for safe diving. Never allow a child to dive into the pool from poolside while playing any water games. All games should be commenced with the child slowly and carefully entering the pool using the steps. Always stay within arm's reach of the child while in the water. Do not allow children to play where water is too deep for their swimming skill and ability. Do not throw them. Do not allow dangerous horseplay.-rinse with clean water after use and dry completely.-Do not allow products to be exposed to direct sunlight for long periods of time.-Store in a cool, dry place.
feature_bullets: SIX (6) COLORFUL DIVE RINGS: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple.
DURABLE DIVING RINGS: Weighted rings sink like dive sticks and stand on the bottom of the pool; Non-toxic plastic rings are easy to see and grab with small hands.
GREAT POOL TOY FOR GIRLS & BOYS: 6 inch diameter swim pool rings! Fun pool toy for adults, too.
SWIM TOY FOR UNDERWATER PLAY: Create your own swimming pool dive and retrieve games!
GREAT SWIM TRAINING: Swim, Dive, Retrieve--Repeat--Quickly improves swimming skills.
